data.text: Do no evil, so shall no harm come unto thee.
Depart from the unjust, and iniquity shall turn away from thee.
My son, sow not upon the furrows of unrighteousness,
Seek not of the Lord preeminence,
Justify not thyself before the Lord;
Seek not to be judge, being not able to take away iniquity;
Offend not against the multitude of a city,
Bind not one sin upon another;
Say not, God will look upon the multitude of my oblations,
Be not fainthearted when thou makest thy prayer,
Laugh no man to scorn in the bitterness of his soul:
Devise not a lie against thy brother;
Use not to make any manner of lie:
Use not many words in a multitude of elders,
Hate not laborious work,
Number not thyself among the multitude of sinners,
Humble thy soul greatly:
Change not a friend for any good by no means;
Forego not a wise and good woman:
Whereas thy servant worketh truly, entreat him not evil,
Let thy soul love a good servant,
Hast thou cattle? have an eye to them:
Hast thou children? instruct them,
Hast thou daughters? have a care of their body,
Marry thy daughter, and so shalt thou have performed a weighty matter:
Hast thou a wife after thy mind? forsake her not.
Honor thy father with thy whole heart,
Remember that thou wast begotten of them;
Fear the Lord with all thy soul,
Love him that made thee with all thy strength,
Fear the Lord, and honor the priest:
And stretch thy hand unto the poor,
A gift hath grace in the sight of every man living;
Fail not to be with them that weep,
Be not slow to visit the sick:
Whatsoever thou takest in hand, remember the end,
